attributes.action: Cap all Council Leaders' and Executives' pay to the same as MPs with no bonuses
attributes.additional_details: Capping their pay to the level of MPs and blocking all bonuses will help to reduce this burden on council tax payers.
attributes.background: Council leaders and executives are increasingly being paid more than the Prime Minister, a ridiculous situation that running a council pays more than running a country. It is council tax payers who are funding these salaries and the pensions that follow.

rejection.details:
Council leaders, like councillors, receive allowances that are set by the local authority, not the UK Government or Parliament. 

In any case, the highest paid council leaders receive a total of around £60k which is not more than the Prime Minister. 

Chief executive pay is also set by the local authority. 

You could start a new petition asking the Government and Parliament to remove pay setting powers for Council Leaders and Executives from local authorities, if that's what you'd like to happen.
